intro: Dendrobium guttulatum, commonly known as the golden spike orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Southeast Asia. It features a sympodial growth habit with multiple stems that produce a profusion of fragrant, golden-yellow flowers. The plant has a long flowering period, often blooming multiple times a year. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. Dendrobium guttulatum thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
